question.para: Is it possible to change the IP address of the master server?

answer.para: Yes. If you are only changing the IP address, it is sufficient to update the /etc/hostsfile, the system configuration, and the DNS entry.

question.para: Why are there restrictions on the length of user and group names? How can I change this?

answer.para: User and group name lengths are specified in the policy. The default maximum username length is 32 characters. The maximum configurable length for user or group names is 255 characters. This complements some supported client operating systems which limit the length of usernames.

question.para: What is the difference between a replica and a master server?

answer.para: A master server maintains a certificate authority. A replica server has its certificate issued by the master CA.

question.para: Why does the ipa-client-installscript fail to find the IPA server on a network that uses Active Directory DNS?

answer.para: Active Directory has its own SRV records for Kerberos and LDAP. The ipa-client-installscript can retrieve those records instead of any that have been added for the &IPA; domain.

When running ipa-client-install, manually enter the server information to ensure that the script uses the &IPA; SRV records instead of &AD; records. The ipa-client-installoptions are listed in the ipa-client-installmanpage.

question.para: Can an administrator who is connected to "Server B" revoke a certificate issued by "Server A"?

answer.para: Yes, assuming that Servers A and B contain non-cloned CAs which have their database information replicated to share revocation information only.
